duties_responsibilities.duty: Lead research teams to realize research goals with broad technical impact.
Reach milestones and produce deliverables for technical projects.
Secure funding for self and technical project teams in a competitive funding environment.
Contribute to technical reports and archival publications with excellent verbal and written communication.
Interact with internal and external customers and management.
Hands-on experience with deep drawing, forging, rolling, wire drawing & swaging, and/or heat treating of metals and alloys and/or other fabrication techniques.
Perform Finite Element Analysis (FEA) of manufacturing systems or modeling of metallurgical phenomena.
Manage security and energy-related research projects where compliance and information protection are required.
Obtain a DOE "Q" security clearance, which usually requires US citizenship.

education_certification.credential: Master's Degree in Engineering from an accredited institution in the areas of mechanical, electrical, metallurgical, materials engineering, mechanical engineering technology, or a related field and 6 years of related experience; or, an equivalent combination of education and experience directly related to the occupation. Ph.D. preferred.
